replies.author: Matthew Potter
replies.text:
Indeed. The decrease on that line was to ensure that the life variable is always given a value that is 0 or above. A Math.abs would correct for your use case however that is just adding to the processing. Honestly though, I'm bored so I'm just looking at re-writing this whole tutorial without jQuery and using classes... this small life system is part of the least of what I would change.

I'm thinking egg class that has a collision method for any object, a chicken class that you apply layEgg() and it generates new eggs then iterates over them, and a game class that allows for progression with additional chickens being added through longer gameplay / increased score.
